page.title: 11FARMING in SPEY VALLEY (1)
page.content:
{Farming}in this area is mixed due to the variety of terrain. Beef and sheep are the main products. A farm of say about 630 acres would support about 70 cows and calves along with twice as many sheep. About one seventh of this ground would be used for growing barley, potatoes, turnips and hay for the farm's own use. Some local farmers benefit from free grazing in the RSPB Bird Reserve.
Whereas 20 years ago the farmer would have employed about six men he can now run it basically on his own, calling on neighbouring farmers for help when necessary, ie harvest time. Big farm machinery such as combine harvesters is hired from neighbours when needed.
